summary: The bill, titled "THE DON-ument Act," proposes the establishment of the Southern Border Wall National Monument along the U.S.-Mexico border. This monument aims to protect the existing border wall from alteration and encompasses approximately 289,920 acres of land in California, Arizona, New Mexico, and Texas. The Secretary of the Interior, through the Bureau of Land Management, will administer the monument and create a management plan, including Memoranda of Understanding with relevant federal agencies and tribal governments. The bill defines the monument's boundaries and the term "southern border wall."
